attributes.action: Keep gyms open throughout the National Lockdown from 5th November 2020
attributes.additional_details:
Gyms have not once been used as a statistic for higher levels of COVID-19 cases. They offer a safe and clean environment where people can successfully social distance whilst improving their physical and mental health. 
In turn keeping them open helps business who would otherwise furlough. Gyms have a two-fold effect on helping individuals’ wellbeing as well as aiding the economy in this sector. 
It is absurd to create a blanket ban without any evidence gyms contribute to rising COVID-19 cases.
attributes.background:
Keep gyms open throughout lockdown. They are vital to keeping the mental health and well-being of the country in good spirits. 

Keeping them open not only helps mental health, but thousands of business owners whose business may not survive a second lockdown.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
